title: Enhancing Noncompetitive Civil Service Appointments of Military Spouses

enrichment.summary: This executive order aims to make it easier for military spouses to get federal government jobs without competing in the usual hiring process. It encourages federal agencies to actively promote hiring military spouses, educate managers about special rules benefiting them, and report annually on the use of this hiring authority to support military families and improve military readiness.
potential_concerns: The noncompetitive hiring authority might unintentionally limit employment opportunities for other federal job seekers by prioritizing military spouses over the general applicant pool, potentially causing perceptions of unfairness within federal hiring.

The effectiveness of the order depends on federal agencies actively promoting and utilizing the military spouse hiring authority; insufficient agency compliance or awareness could undermine intended benefits for military spouses and military readiness.

Relocations to locations with limited federal job openings may still hinder military spouses' employment despite this order, particularly impacting military families stationed in remote or rural areas.
Without addressing licensure portability and other occupational barriers comprehensively, noncompetitive hiring alone may not fully resolve employment challenges faced by military spouses.

If human resources and hiring managers are inadequately trained on telework and flexible work options, military spouses may still face difficulties maintaining consistent employment amid frequent moves.
